Google Cloud Introduction 44 Lessons learned â€¢ The history of the relational model contains several important lessons: â€¢ How you store, place in memory, and query data are three different things â€¢ If they are tied together, things become difficult (physical data independence) â€¢ Writing programs for extracting knowledge out of data is not efficient â€¢ Writing queries that involve knowing how the data is organized is not efficient â€¢ The relational model won because it provided physical (and logical) data independence, and adopted relational algebra to reason about how data is manipulated and combined.
